Remove an Account (Main or Sub-Account)

Source: R/helpers.R
remove_account.Rd

Deletes an account from the account tree. If the uuid matches the main/root account, the user's entire account file is removed. Otherwise, the function locates the target account within the tree and removes it from its parent.

Usage

remove_account(tree, user_id, uuid)

Arguments

tree

An R6 account tree object (e.g., created via MainAccount$new()).

user_id

Character string. The unique identifier of the user who owns the account tree. Used to locate and delete the user's persisted file.

uuid

Character string. The UUID of the account to be removed.

Value

Logical TRUE if the account was successfully removed. Throws an error if the account or its parent cannot be found.

Details

- If the UUID corresponds to the main/root account:

  • The user's "account_tree.Rds" file is deleted from persistent storage.

- If the UUID corresponds to a sub-account:

  • The target account is located via tree$find_account_by_uuid(uuid).

  • Its parent is identified, and the child is removed from parent$child_accounts.

  • The updated tree is saved back to persistent storage with save_user_file().

See also

[find_account_by_uuid()], [save_user_file()]

Examples

if (FALSE) {
library(finman)

# Create a main account
main <- MainAccount$new("Main")

# Add a sub-account
needs <- ChildAccount$new("Needs", allocation = 0.5)
main$add_child_account(needs)

# Add a grandchild account
rent <- GrandchildAccount$new(
  "Rent", allocation = 0.3, fixed_amount = 7500,
  account_type = "Bill", freq = 30, due_date = Sys.Date() + 30
)
needs$add_child_account(rent)

# Persist the account tree
save_user_file("user123", main, "account_tree.Rds")

# Remove the grandchild account by uuid
remove_account(main, "user123", rent$uuid)

# Remove the main account (deletes the file)
remove_account(main, "user123", main$uuid)
}
